intro: Diapedium pectinatum, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Diapedium pectinatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
